page.title: 17Hellingly Hospital
page.content: {Hellingly Hospital}is a Victorian building which was opened as the{ { East Sussex Lunatic Asylum}in 1904. The hospital is a large building and has a small car park to the right for{ {visitors}and{staff}to park their cars in. The bricks are a dark red colour with cream cement holding them together. The hospital looks uninviting because of its size and shape which seems to swallow you up. The {windows}on the hospital are quite large with white painted window frames. The {shape}of the hospital from above is not regular.It is a very small,wide cone shape but it is not a true cone.It is mainly{90 degree right {angles}getting closer to each other until they touch at the South.The roof is not one{ridge}it has many open courtyards all oddly shaped. {By Nicholas Graham
